page.title: 15Pitney,origin of name
page.content:
Pitney was mentioned in the Domesday Book as a 'Royal Property'.The name used to be spelt 'Puttney Lortie', Putt meaning soft dirt and ney an island.It was rented from the King for a shilling a year by the De Lortie family .There is a local story that if anyone hears you live in Pitney they will say to you "how is the harbour ?" One end of the village still floods after long periods of severe rain!
Farmers used to keep large flocks of sheep as well as cows.The sheep_wash can still be seen in the stream that runs through the village.
There were several cider presses in the village,all the farmers had enough cider to last them through the year.
